channel.description: Recent content in Posts on khast3x blog

item.title: h8mail v2.5 release
item.description: Updating If you used the standard pip install method : $ pip3 install --upgrade h8mail New features & Changelog Fetch a single or list of URLs and target emails found using --url or -u Dehashed API added - closes #47 Emailrep.io private API added - :key: (free!) Data parsed extended Full data enrichment from API providers integrated (found addresses, phone etc…) Rewrote better documentation, now maintained as a wiki!

item.title: h8mail v2.4 release

Abstract

h8mail 2.4 has been released. This one is quick but deadly.

Click here to read previous h8mail v2.3 release post.

item.title: Serving payloads in the cloud with Metasploit and Docker
item.description: Traefik Done - Reverse http+tcp Use the docker-compose.yml method to deploy Defining each service attached to each definition solved the multi service error Want to try with tcp This Doc page with more details on making rules/chaning them here Securing the docker host exposing the the api here Test staged payload How to run docker-compose up [new connection] docker exec -it msfconsole /bin/bash ./msfconsole -r web_delivery.rc > run OR for TCP set payload 10 + set LPORT 8888 + run transport add -t reverse_http -u handler -l 163.

h8mail 2.3 has been released. In this blog post, we’ll be having an overview of all the new features.
Click here to read previous h8mail v2 release post.

item.title: Password Breaches with Docker and h8mail
item.description:
In this tutorial, we’re going to move downloading and searching operations to the cloud to speed things up.
We’ll achieve this using a torrent downloader container, the h8mail container and a shared volume. For demonstration purposes, we’ll be studying the Breach Compilation.

item.title: Getting started with h8mail v2

In the following write-up, we’ll be covering h8mail’s options with examples and use-cases. At the end of this page, you’ll hopefully be bringing passwords back like a necromancer ðŸ’€

item.title: Cloud reverse-shell: Hershell, Metasploit and Docker
item.description:
In the following article we’ll be deploying Hershell, a minimal golang reverse shell, and its C2 using Docker to host it on a cloud provider’s infrastructure.
One of the many powers of golang is it’s cross platform capabilities. Since the codebase is minimal, we’ll see how to use a container to host our C2.

item.title: Hardening Android : Browsers
item.description: Hardening Android with Privacy-Focused Browsers This is a quick post about my experience with browsers on Android. I’ll be showing off how I’ve configured my phone for daily usage. You might be gaining performance too! I consider two major use-cases when it comes to opening links on my phone. Opening links from various apps without much prior knowledge of content. I want this to be as sandboxed as possible.

item.title: Hardening Android : DNS
item.description:
• Hardening Android with DNS66 & Quad9
    • Demo
    • Installing the F-Droid Store & DNS66

Hardening Android with DNS66 & Quad9

_I’ll be illustrating a simple and very effective way to harden your Android phone without needing root. Demo below._
